subject: Sexual Health
title: A Brief History of STIs
description: Learn A Brief History of STIs in one minute.

hook.text: Syphilis ravaged Europe in the 1490s. Soldiers spread it across borders faster than armies could march.

buildup.text: For centuries, STIs were blamed on moral failure. Science was nowhere near understanding the true cause.

discovery.text: In the 1900s, scientists identified bacteria and viruses as the actual agents behind these diseases.

twist.text: Penicillin cured syphilis in the 1940s, but new STIs like HIV emerged just decades later.

climax.text: History shows that STIs evolve alongside us. Each era faces its own sexual health challenges.

punchline.text: Old diseases fade. New ones always appear.
